subject: Critical Thinking
title: Reversible vs. Irreversible Decisions
description: A fast breakdown of Reversible vs. Irreversible Decisions for builders.

hook.text: Jeff Bezos divides decisions into 'one-way doors' and 'two-way doors'. Each deserves different treatment.

buildup.text: Two-way doors: decide fast, iterate, learn. The cost of reversal is low. Most daily decisions are two-way.

discovery.text: One-way doors: decide carefully, gather evidence, consult broadly.

twist.text: The mistake most people make: treating two-way doors like one-way doors.

climax.text: The opposite mistake is worse: treating one-way doors like two-way doors.

punchline.text: Reversible? Decide fast. Irreversible? Decide wisely.

quiz.question: How should 'two-way door' decisions be treated?
options: Decided quickly, since they can be reversed easily
